meanings.definition: To outsnore: to snore louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Last night, I managed to outsnore my brother during our sleepover.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outsnore me, but I think I'm the champion snorer.
meanings.sent3: During the camping trip, my friend tried to outsnore me, but I snored even louder!
meanings.sent4: In the snoring competition, I aimed to outsnore everyone and claim the trophy.
meanings.sent5: The challenge was to outsnore the bear in the forest to win the bet.

meanings.definition: Outsnore: louder snoring than someone else.
meanings.sent1: His outsnore could be heard throughout the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The loud outsnore from the room next door kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The cat's outsnore was so unexpected that it made us all burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her outsnore was like a thunderstorm in the quiet night, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The outsnore of the old man in the library startled everyone with its intensity.

meanings.definition: Outsnore: to surpass in snoring volume.
meanings.sent1: I always try to outsnore my dad, but he somehow manages to be louder.
meanings.sent2: During the sleepover, my friend challenged me to outsnore him, and I accepted.
meanings.sent3: The snoring contest was fierce, but I was determined to outsnore everyone.
meanings.sent4: As the night went on, my attempts to outsnore the dog became a hilarious competition.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to outsnore the neighbor's cat, whose snores echoed through the walls.
